post.author: 임정숙
post.content:
You can always negotiate the time and duration.   The employer might ask you for Minimum hours per week but you don't have to say 'OK' to everything they asked you to do.   Tell the employer about your situation such as distance from your home or family.  You can work little longer hours some days and get a or two days off on certian days and so on.  They will understand if you have the right reason.  And anyway, they know they are not paying anything for your service...

PLEASE do not think this is a waste of your time or money.  It is a good investment for your future and will be a good chance to test how you can fit in this industry... right?  

I know~~Now you will feel that those companies are using your highly skilled service for nothing, but you have to remember that you are also using them for better oppoertunities ahead of you.

If you are not employeed currently, it is better than doing nothing.  You will have more chance to practice your English and have more opportunity to make friends in the same industry...  there is so many good thing than bad things.

Be positive and good luck!


>It will usually be 5 days a week and the working hour depends on the company you will be working for, but mostly between 7 and 8 hours a day.
>
